titleStmt.title: A most straunge, rare, and horrible murther committed by a Frenchman of the age of too or three and twentie yeares who hath slaine and most cruelly murthered three seuerall persons, to wit, the inkeeper or tauerner of Hectot vpoon the ... nere vnto Roane in Normandy, with the wife and childe of the same tauerner, and also at his departure did set fire on the house. Wherein also is declared and shewed the terrible and worthy pupnishment done and executed vppon him for the same, in Roane aforesaide. Done out of Frenche into English by Æuesham. 1586.
titleStmt.author: Aevesham.

titleStmt.title: A most straunge, rare, and horrible murther committed by a Frenchman of the age of too or three and twentie yeares who hath slaine and most cruelly murthered three seuerall persons, to wit, the inkeeper or tauerner of Hectot vpoon the ... nere vnto Roane in Normandy, with the wife and childe of the same tauerner, and also at his departure did set fire on the house. Wherein also is declared and shewed the terrible and worthy pupnishment done and executed vppon him for the same, in Roane aforesaide. Done out of Frenche into English by Æuesham. 1586.
titleStmt.author: Aevesham.

publicationStmt.publisher: By Thomas Purfoote, and are to bee solde at his shoppe without Newgate, ouer agaynste Saincte Sepulchers Churche,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the Corpus Christi College (University of Oxford). Library.
With: A merry, pleasant, and delectable historie, betweene K. Edward the fourth, a[n]d a tanner of Tamworth. At London : Printed by W. White, 1613.
